title: Is there any way to add new instruments in GarageBand? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes. You can download Audio Units (AU) plugins for GarageBand. You can use Audio Units plug-ins in your GarageBand projects to add new sounds and effects. Some Audio Units may be installed on your computer, and many more are available from other sources. You can buy Audio Units plug-ins from a variety of third-party vendors, and find free Audio Units on the Internet. GarageBand for Mac: Use Audio Units plug-ins with GarageBand Check that link for more information on downloading, installing and using AU plugins. *EDIT: If you haven’t done so already, you can also download more sounds by clicking on the GarageBand tab in the upper left and pull down the menu to Sound Library and slide over to Download All Available Sounds. This gives you all the sounds from the Logic recording app as well.

When I tried using iOS GarageBand on my iPhone, I thought it was confusing that I had to record an instrument before I could add another track. I thought this question was asking how to add a new instrument in “Track View”. I made a video tutorial, because I was stumped by GarageBand on my iPhone (its obvious on iPad, but not on iPhone).
